text:
The resto just opened like a month ago. already a fan of their other BYOB (Quartier Général on the Plateau)

food and prices are really amazing; 4 course meal for less than 40$ 

fantastic service, our waiter was very polite and very knowledgeable; explained all courses very well

u pick a main dish add 12$ and u end up with: starter (soup or salad), appetizer, main dish, dessert
u can go ala carte if u want, but really recommend the table d'hote

mostly market cuisine, very simple in most case, but very tasty.

i had a pied de veau (veal foot!!) wich is one of the best appetizer i'va had!! very difficult to explain (kind of pulled veal with a bit of fat, made in a fried square??!! kapish?!!)

took the rabbit for main, same rabbit that they serve at Quartier Général, and it's always sooo goood; not dry at all, stuffed with yummies

they only "letdown" was my baba o rum for dessert, it was good but not at the level of the other 2 courses.

my GF had a duck tartare for app wich was excellent and the beef cheeck for main that was very good and tender, but maybe had a little too much fat?
dessert was a chocolate type of cake/mousse/fondant wich was perfect for a chocolate lover!

hands down the best BYOB in the area... and in my TOP3 in MTL

Went there last night with my Parents.  Recommended by the concierge of the hotel we staying at.  Not in a touristy part of Montreal, but we were at the Botanical Gardens that was not far away.  I think we were the only tourist there.  I liked the restaurant a lot.  Service was good and the food was very good too.  I liked the way the menu was done, no meal would cost more than $40 a person for the full courses.  We had the scallops and foie gras for appentizer and they were great.  I had the Lapin (rabbit) was was good.  My Parents had the veal and cod which was good too.  Since this is a BYOB place, they do not sell any alcohol at all, so bring your own.

I do recommend this.  May be out of the way for tourist.  Seems to be a great neighbourhood restaurant.

I have to say I had high expectations but I was disappointed .. So were my friends ... There was nothing to brag about... The food was tasteless and sides were nothing impressive... I love Le Quartier General from the same owners... Too bad .. But since it's new we'll see how it turns out in the future!

My girlfriend and I went there for our anniversary and this place was the perfect spot for us. Being young- I loved the BYO Wine policy as we could drink and have a good time without draining our pockets. The ambiance was very nice and that of a modern yet classy french restaurant. The 4 course meals were simply delicious and for once I felt like I was immersed in the taste. I felt like I was transported back to eating in a french restaurant Toulouse. Total for me and my girlfriend was under $100, for an amazing laid back experience with great experience. I would recommend everyone to try it out.
Great food! Very well prepared and presented. We had the duck tartare, the lamb and the duck magret, all very very good! Prices around 28 cad and it is BYOW. Great place for enjoying a nice dinner!

Voilà une bonne adresse à conserver dans le calepin pour HOMA.  Service attentionné et professionnel sans être guindé.  Le menu saura plaire aux amateurs de viande particulièrement.  Le porcelet tout comme le magret de canard étaient succulents lors de mon passage.  Les légumes d'accompagnement et leur assaisonnement étaient loin d'être en reste.  J'ai bien aimé en finale le gâteau au fromage, consistant et frais.  C'est un restaurant où "apportez votre vin" ne rime pas avec une cuisine fade et insipide.  On y retourne?  Fort probablement.

From the moment you pass the door, your nose will know you're in a great restaurant - whiffs coming from the kitchen will make you want to sit down and look at the menu as fast as you can.
I went three times in the last month... The menu and the prices are different for lunch (and so is the chef, I've been told), but the quality and creativity are a constant. A few great seafood dishes on the menu, more than what you'd expect from a non-seafood restaurant, which is good! Meats and fish are cooked to perfection, everything is tasty, the service is friendly. A perfect balance between a classic approach to cuisine and a refreshing creativity.

This is a fabulous neighborhood restaurant in the Quebecois section of Montreal.   We had an fantastic meal there about a month ago.  Both the food and service were excellent, without being ridiculous and over-the-top.

 I'd go back in a nanosecond.

Be forewarned:  this restaurant does not have a liquor license.  You need to bring your own wine.  

They have two seatings, so I suggest booking a reservation in advance.
Un très bon restaurant du quartier Hochelaga ! La nourriture et le service est d'une grande qualité !Cependant, pour un souper tranquille, c'est pas le bon choix. La salle est très bruillante.

Ambiance huppée et chaleureux. Un menu saisonier qui a du panache. Huîtres ou canard, la présentation est orginale et délicate.

"Tombez dans les pommes"  avec un bon dessert automnale ou choisissez parmi un bouquet garni de savoureuses créations de l'État Major.

Bouffe de très grande qualité à un prix plus que raisonnable! Le menu change à chaque semaine alors il y a toujours quelque chose de nouveau à essayer. Fine cuisine, resto assez chic, mais pas trop, ça en fait un endroit idéal pour une date. En plus, c'est apportez votre vin alors il te restera du budget pour ta prochaine date!

Really one of the best BYOB in Montreal. This little brother of "Quartier general" is a sure hit!  Service is very professional, and well informed. Menu is  varied and very well executed. It is in a rather remote location, but a fun area to visit, with easy parking. The prices are really decent. Bring on your good bottles, and you are sure to have a delicious great time!

Un autre superbe endroit dans Homa. On a maintenant le choix entre ce resto ou les Canailles pour un apportez votre vin, vive le choix. 

Le service est impeccable et je n'ai absolument rien a dire pour le rapport qualité prix (autre qu'il est excellent). mon conjoint a trouvé que l'endroit était un peu trop éclairé et moi au contraire j'ai adoré le décor avec son foyer et ses grandes fenêtres (local qui hébergeait l'ancien Van Houtte)

Merci a l'Etat Major d'avoir choisi notre quartier pour vous établir
Un très beau resto avec un menu très varié ! Par contre, les plat sont un peu trop relevé(très salé) à mon gout , mais rien de grave je vais y retourner c'est certain !

Excellent restaurant "apportez votre vin".  6-8 choix de plats principaux mais d'une grande qualité et avec une bonne variété. Tout est fait maison même les desserts. Service impeccable et rapide même un vendredi soir où le resto est bondé.

J'adore j'adore j'adore!!!
Service : IM-PEC. Les serveurs étaients accueillants, souriants, conviviaux et service pas prétentieux du tout!
Bouffe: Le concept 4 services est formidable! Pour 14$ de plus au plat principal, on peut avoir un repas très complet et recherché! En plus du apportez votre vin...! Que peut on demander de plus?
Décor: plus d'espace et plus ouvert que le quartier général! Plus lumineux aussi! Les deux sont agréables!
Quartier: en croissance! 

J'y retourne c'est certain!
Très bon, bons accompagnements, bon service et table d'hôte copieuse à prix raisonnable.

Est-ce que je vous ai déjà dis que le service est impeccable? 
Une de mes restaurants préférés!
Great meal had pork someone else had the monkfish and the venison and shrimp suRf and turf. Wonderful flavor profiles and bring your own wine.

L'état major figure parmi les beaux et bons restaurants d'Hocelaga! C'est un apportez votre vin en plus! Les plats sont quand même dispendieux, mais viennent avec une entrée de souper de salades et comme tu peux payer 10$ ta bouteille de vin, ça vaut la peine!! 

Nous aimons beaucoup y aller et nous le recommandons absolument!

If you like Quartier General, you will like this one as it's the same owner.

The restaurant is beautifully decorated, great food, good service and it's a BYOW!

Had a group reservation at 6 for a birthday and they said we had to leave at 9 which was very reasonable considering that most places will only give you 2 hours.

All the dishes we had were very well executed in terms of presentation and flavour. The menu was very diversified and the chef was able to accommodate my friend who's a vegetarian.

Took the short rib as an entree and it was fall off the bone tender! 

As a main, I had the piglet which was very moist and flavourful...no intense flavour there but well balanced with the vegetables which accompanied the dish. 

Friends also took the fish and duck magret also said that their dish were yummy.

The dessert was the best part, homemade donut with ice cream and caramel sauce. The donut was fluffy and crispy. The caramel sauce wasn't too sweet and the ice cream was refreshing.

Definitely recommend it. The table d'hôte was about $40...a bargain considering that I went to Europea the day before and didn't even come close to the excellent meal I had at Etat Major.

Will be back for sure!

Lovely restaurant with wonderful service. It's BYOB, but there's an affordable little wine stop across the street.

Parking was on-street and easy on a Wednesday night. 

Food was delicious, but portions were small. He was starving after his pork dish. I was just fine with mine (he is an eater).

I was stunned to find such a great restaurant so far from the "standard" dining areas. The ambiance was charming, the food was tasty (and perfectly suited for fall) and the service was exceptional. 

Portions are full plates, but the quality is at a much higher standard than you'd expect for something so reasonably priced. 

I got the magret de canard, which my phone keeps insisting is "magnet" de canard. But frankly, if there were magnets in the dish, I'd tell the chef to keep doing what he's doing. Oh, and all main courses come with a soup or salad. 

Great spot. Definitely worth checking out.

Je ne dirais pas que c'est siiiiiiiiiiii bien décoré. À titre d'exemple, je trouve que les ampoules avec les filaments de tungstène, c'est devenu assez générique. Les menus à l'ardoise aussi. Les attraits visuels principaux sont la cuisine ouverte et la très grande fenestration, et les plats eux-mêmes! De plus, il ne sont pas qu'attrayants, ils sont très bons! La table d'hôte a vraiment un bon rapport qualité-prix à 14$ supplémentaires seulement. Toutes les assiettes sont en bonne portion également: j'ai pourtant un bon appétit et je suis sortie repue!

Le service est vraiment exceptionnel et je pèse mes mots. À la fin du repas, j'ai dit à la serveuse qu'elle avait été complice d'un moment agréable et elle a répondu modestement que ça lui faisait plaisir d'échanger avec des clients d'une manière décontractée :) Ses explications du menu étaient claires et précises. En fait, toutes ses interventions à la table étaient attentives et discrètes (servir puis retirer les couverts, remplir nos coupes de vin, replier ma serviette de table par exemple). 

La salle à manger peut devenir bruyante en raison de sa configuration mais les tables sont raisonnablement espacées, je m'y suis sentie bien. Et c'est ce point qui est le plus important, au final, être à l'aise. Merci de nous avoir réservé votre meilleur accueil sans prétention, même si nous sommes jeunes/en T-shirt/potentiellement néophytes de la cuisine française/etc.

We had an excellent experience here! As non-French speakers the staff was very accommodating and attentive, making sure we understood the menu. We sat at the bar with a birds' eye view of the chefs at work. The salad and squash soup were both wonderful, and the chef sent out a duck filet on bruschetta which was even moreso. We ordered the Arctic char and the mahi-mahi entrees and were blown away; perfect flavor pairings and both dishes were cooked perfectly. The chocolate ganache dessert was also divine. We would come back every night if we could!

Great bring your own wine in mtl for a reasonable price.

Service was a little bit slow,so that was annoying.

Food was pretty good too, i would recommend taking the table d'hote for 14 more dollars.

Went there 2-3 times and every time it was quite great, food-wise and service-wise. So I decided to go again tonight. Left a reservation on the answering machine during their afternoon break. The message says they'll call you back to confirm or state it's fully booked. Never got a call back. Called right now and they're complete for the night, and the guy who picked up admitted my message was probably still sitting in the voice mail, forgotten forever. WTF?

Chic restaurant avec menu relevé et service efficace. Apportez votre vin. Plats bons au goût et à l'il. Moins d'originalité dans les desserts. Le quartier où il est situé semble en processus de rénovation générale.

Perfect place to go with close friends. Arrive early since the first service ends at 20h45. Nice bar not far from there: Madame Smith. Read review.

The service was excellent! The food was very good. The price is very good given then fact that it's a byob. A little bit on the noisy side but the atmosphere was great!! I would most definitely recommend this place to anyone and i will come back fir sure
